sourceNotes: Editorial guidance prepared by Pitchchat; not sourced from user submissions.
title: Finance Seed fundraising metrics benchmarks
summary: Seed-stage fintech metrics focus on early product-market fit and sustainable unit economics. Post-bubble, investors heavily weight efficiency metrics alongside growth. These benchmarks help demonstrate you're building a business, not just acquiring users. Pitchchat keeps fundraising metrics investor-ready in one room.

metrics.label: Monthly Active Users
metrics.note: Active users with meaningful engagement. Quality matters—active users who transact regularly are more valuable than sign-ups.

metrics.label: Monthly Transaction Volume
metrics.note: Total volume processed monthly. Shows financial activity scale and trust.

metrics.label: Monthly Revenue
metrics.note: Revenue from all sources. Early revenue demonstrates willingness to pay and business model viability.

metrics.label: Customer Acquisition Cost
metrics.note: Fully loaded CAC. Varies by segment and model. Should show improvement trajectory.

metrics.label: LTV:CAC Ratio
metrics.note: Early stage ratio showing path to 4:1+. Based on actual customer behavior, not projections.

metrics.label: Net Promoter Score
metrics.note: High NPS indicates product-market fit and supports organic growth critical in fintech.

metrics.label: Gross Margin
metrics.note: Varies by model. Interchange-based lower, subscription higher. Should be clear path to target.

metrics.label: Monthly User Growth
metrics.note: Month-over-month user growth. Quality of growth matters—organic preferred over paid.

metrics.label: Regulatory Status
metrics.note: Key licenses identified and application process underway. Banking partners secured or in discussion.

metrics.label: Team Size
metrics.note: Core team with product, engineering, and compliance capability. Lean but sufficient for regulatory requirements.
